question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Find the product of $10101_2$ and $101_2$. Express your answer in base $2$.
ground_truth:
Carry out the multiplication as you would with base $10$. There is no need to carry during the multiplication with base $2$.

$$\begin{array}{c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c} &&&&1&0&1&0&1_2\\ &&&&&\times&1&0&1_2\\ \cline{2-9} &&&_1&1^{\text{ }}&0^1&1^{\text{ }}&0^{\text{ }}&1^{\text{ }}_2\\ &+&1^{\text{ }}&0^{\text{ }}&1&0_{\text{ }}&1&0&0_2\\ \cline{2-9} &&1&1&0&1&0&0&1_2\\ \end{array}$$Add it up for a final answer of $\boxed{1101001_2}$.

question:
$10101_2 * 101_2 = 10101_2 * 100_2 + 10101_2 * 1_2 = 1010100_2 + 10101_2 = 100010011_2$
Final Answer: $\boxed{100010011_2}$. I hope it is correct.
There might be an error in the solution above because of lack of understanding of the question. Please correct the error, if any, and rewrite the solution. Only output the final solution \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
ground_truth:
Carry out the multiplication as you would with base $10$. There is no need to carry during the multiplication with base $2$.

$$\begin{array}{c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c} &&&&1&0&1&0&1_2\\ &&&&&\times&1&0&1_2\\ \cline{2-9} &&&_1&1^{\text{ }}&0^1&1^{\text{ }}&0^{\text{ }}&1^{\text{ }}_2\\ &+&1^{\text{ }}&0^{\text{ }}&1&0_{\text{ }}&1&0&0_2\\ \cline{2-9} &&1&1&0&1&0&0&1_2\\ \end{array}$$Add it up for a final answer of $\boxed{1101001_2}$.
